title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
npm joined #xwiki at 00:05  
marta left at 00:54 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 02:25  
savi joined #xwiki at 02:34  
jvelociter left at 02:48 (Quit: jvelociter  
LadySerena - (02:50): in my vCore System, I'm separating the data type classes from the handler classes  :D  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:52): I wanted to mention to you that you can get better performance from the database driver by applying a patch I wrote a while back.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:53): It's not in the source tree because I was afraid of what it might do with a corrupted but functional database.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:54): Okay that's hard to beat :)  
LadySerena - (02:55): :D  
LadySerena - (02:55): and I do the thing where the app gets its DB connection from GlassFish's JDBC settings and connection pool  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (02:56): Did you see my note earlier about why I love postgres?  
LadySerena - (02:56): nuuuuu, I didn't  
LadySerena - (02:57): ahs  
LadySerena - (02:58): actually, I've found CHAR makes things faster than VARCHAR  
LadySerena - (02:58): tables with fixed-length rows are faster than tables with variable-length rows  
LadySerena - (02:59): CHAR brings you fixed-length, VARCHAR makes variable-length  
LadySerena - (02:59): thus, VARCHAR is made of pure evil  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:00): I see (just read the page)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:01): But then for big stuff like pages and text areas you want it to be variable.  
LadySerena - (03:01): well ya  
LadySerena - (03:01): but I keep my access speeds up by separating all the meta from the data  
LadySerena - (03:02): like I have system\_members and system\_members\_sigs  
LadySerena - (03:02): the \_sigs table has all the variable-length post signatures  
LadySerena - (03:02): the other table is all fixed-length  
LadySerena - (03:02): same with my forum\_posts and forum\_posts\_content  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:03): But then someone with a long name breaks it (rare though).  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:05): It's an opinion but I like the idea of sacrificing speed for less "oh no" moments like the IRC log overrunning the db table.  
LadySerena - (03:06): as it currently is, the site only allows membernames to be 25 characters  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (03:07): The hacker in me says "fast!" But the designer in me says "but what if..."  
nickless left at 03:29 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
CalebJamesDeLisl left at 04:09 (Quit: Thanks for the answer.  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 04:10  
LadySerena - (04:25): hai again CalebJamesDeLisl  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (04:27): yea, /quit doesn't do what I thought it did :)  
LadySerena - (04:30): XD  
LadySerena - (04:49): I still need to support components so I can just drop in Velocity support, among other things.  
savi left at 04:49 (Quit: savi  
savi joined #xwiki at 04:51  
LadySerena - (04:51): (like the way I just had to write one class and got PHP support in XWiki via my phpMacro)  
savi left at 05:09 (Quit: savi  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (05:09): I've been thinking about writing a new storage component, make everything an XObject (even documents) try to make it short, fast and simple. </wild Idea>

Denis joined #xwiki at 06:09  
savi joined #xwiki at 06:12  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 06:49  
savi left at 07:11 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:32  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:03): Good morning vmassol, do you have some time to discuss script vs. java?  
vmassol - (09:05): Hi CalebJamesDeLisl  
vmassol - (09:05): not really now, just waking up, need some family time :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:06): Ok, let me know when it's a good time, I have a few ideas...  
vmassol - (09:06): you could send a mail to the list maybe, it's easier over week ends in general to get people's feedbacks  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:08): I have a few proposals cooking already, anyway this is abstract at the moment.  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 09:08  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 10:12  
marta joined #xwiki at 10:17  
richy joined #xwiki at 10:52  
richy left #xwiki at 11:25  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:50  
nickless joined #xwiki at 12:56  
headache joined #xwiki at 13:08  
headache - (13:08): hello  
sdumitriu - (13:09): Hi headache  
headache - (13:10): i've a little problem i will try to resolve next week about my GSoC partecipation  
headache - (13:11): my professor yesterday said to me that he can't support me for a thesis about GSoC  
headache - (13:12): and i'm at the starting point :| now i will search a new professor that take my work for GSoC as a thesis for a bachelor degree  
headache - (13:13): in computer science  
sdumitriu - (13:13): Well, why did he say that?  
sdumitriu - (13:13): Are you sure you explained exactly what GSoC means?  
headache - (13:14): sdumitriu, this professor support other students last year  
headache - (13:14): in my university there are 3 computer science courses  
headache - (13:15): and there's a tacit rule that say that one student must have a relator correlated with his computer science course  
headache - (13:16): in my case this professor that support students for GSoC is not a professor in my course...  
headache - (13:16): formally there are no problems but practically there is  
headache - (13:17): ops bad english  
headache - (13:17): :D  
headache - (13:17): however i hope i will find other professor related to my C.S course that evalute my partecipation to GSoC as a thesis  
headache - (13:18): i live in Italy that's the price to pay for so stupid "tacit" rules among professors  
headache - (13:18): :(  
bblfish - (13:18): all personal profile documents on webid.myxwiki.org are now OpenIds  
bblfish - (14:11): the names of the openids are a bit long. It would be another step to fix that  
vmassol - (14:12): bblfish: I need to take some time to try you stuff… I'm still debugging an important bug for the XE 2.2.3 release of next week  
bblfish - (14:12): ok, no problem. It just keeps improving :-)  
vmassol - (14:12): cool  
bblfish - (14:23): it would be nice if one could change the DOCTYPe on certain types of pages  
vmassol - (14:24): you can actually  
bblfish - (14:24): ah I was looking at the presentation preferences page  
vmassol - (14:24): you just need to create a custom skin and override htmlheader.vm  
vmassol - (14:25): then you do an if in your version of htmlheader.vm and put what you want for those pages  
vmassol - (14:25): let me find the skin tutorial for you  
bblfish - (14:25): thanks  
vmassol - (14:26): hmm Raluca seems to be have broken the page but it should still be barely readable: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/XWikiNewSkin  
bblfish - (14:29): ok, let me look at that. It's just to fix the rdfa  
vmassol - (14:29): basically you need to do the following:  
vmassol - (14:30): 1) edit the XWiki.XWikiSkins class and add a "htmlheader.vm" property of type Textarea  
vmassol - (14:31): 2) go to the admin page, click on presentation and click on Customize button next to the skin  
vmassol - (14:31): 3) copy paste the default htmlheader.vm in the htmlheader textarea:  
bblfish - (14:32): ok, thanks, will do that, then go visit paris  
vmassol - (14:32): wait finding the url for you  
sdumitriu - (14:32): Alternative:  
sdumitriu - (14:32): 1) make a local copy of the htmlheader.vm file, where you put the new doctype  
sdumitriu - (14:32): 2) upload it as an attachment of the skin document  
vmassol - (14:33): sdumitriu: right, either choice  
bblfish - (14:33): the second sounds like I could add it to git, and make it easier to install...  
vmassol - (14:33): http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/skin/templates/htmlheader.vm  
vmassol - (14:34): the first one too  
vmassol - (14:34): since you can export it as a XAR  
vmassol - (14:34): it's the same  
vmassol - (14:34): in term of exporting  
vmassol - (14:34): what we're doing is simply having a page defining a skin as an object  
vmassol - (14:34): so in essence a custom skin is simply a wiki page  
vmassol - (14:35): and thus you can export it as a standard wiki page  
vmassol - (14:35): and reimport is a standard wiki page too  
vmassol - (14:35): s/is/it/  
bblfish - (14:35): wgeb tiy say "upload as an attachment of the skin document", you mean I should attach that to http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WebId/XWikiUserProfileSheet  
vmassol - (14:35): no  
vmassol - (14:35): you need to follow the steps I gave  
bblfish - (14:35): ok  
vmassol - (14:36): you can read the tutorial I gave  
sdumitriu - (14:36): I really hate doctypes...  
vmassol - (14:36): it has a lot more explanations  
bblfish - (14:38): the doctypes are useful for automatic testing, but yes, they are a bit old hat  
nuvolari left at 14:45 (Remote host closed the connection  
savi joined #xwiki at 14:53  
sdumitriu - (14:54): I really don't understand why people want to stay to the SGML model...  
sdumitriu - (14:54): XML+namespaces is the way to go  
sdumitriu - (14:55): No need for custom doctypes every time you want to combine a new language in the HTML  
sdumitriu - (14:55): Like, what doctype do you use if you want to have both RDFa and MathML in the same document?  
nuvolari joined #xwiki at 14:56  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:59): I just found that the default schema is null, shouldn't it be the main wiki name?  
sdumitriu - (14:59): Are you sure?  
sdumitriu - (14:59): Doesn't Hibernate use the right name based on the config file?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:00): That's what the test showed, I hacked up HibernateStore but that shouldn't have caused it to be null.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:07): Just double checked on a clean copy (2.2.2) same deal.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:07): println(xcontext.getContext().getWiki().getHibernateStore().getConfiguration().getProperty(Environment.DEFAULT\_SCHEMA));  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:07): returns null  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:08): Same for DEFAULT\_CATALOG  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:10): What concerns me is that getSchemaUpdateScript( stores the schema, sets it to a subwiki name, then puts it back if the original is not null. If the original is null, undefined state...  
jvelociter - (15:11): sdumitriu: Hi. I'm looking for the basic auth issue that has been fixed recently  
Denis left at 15:11 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter - (15:11): do you remember which VM has been modified?  
jvelociter - (15:12): ok I think its   XWIKI-4695  
sdumitriu - (15:14): Yes  
sdumitriu - (15:14): accessdenied.vm, IIRC  
jvelociter - (15:14): yep  
nuvolari - (15:16): anyone using intellij (community version?)  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:19  
sdumitriu - (15:27): vmassol is using it from time to time  
vmassol - (15:27): nuvolari: nope, I'm using the ultimate edition ;)  
bblfish - (15:46): it's too complicated this skin thing. Wasting my time on something that can be done in a few minutes I am sure...  
bblfish - (15:46): I'll wait until next week.  
adityakg joined #xwiki at 15:47  
vmassol - (15:53): bblfish: give me 1 mn and I'll prepare the vm for you  
vmassol - (15:53): you have the class locked, I'm forcing edition  
vmassol - (15:53): rdfa.vm is wrong  
vmassol - (15:53): it's htmlheader.vm  
vmassol - (15:53): adding it  
bblfish - (15:54): I created this http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WebId/RDFaSkin  
bblfish - (15:54): yes, rdfa.vm is wrong, but there is no easy way to delete it  
vmassol - (15:55): ok done  
vmassol - (15:55): you can now edit the skin at http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/DefaultSkin  
vmassol - (15:55): and modify the content of the htmlheader.vm field  
vmassol - (15:55): to add your own logic  
bblfish - (15:55): ah ok, do I do antyhing with http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WebId/RDFaSkin  
bblfish - (15:55): ?  
vmassol - (15:55): well it's up to dyou  
bblfish - (15:55): let me do the easy thing first  
vmassol - (15:55): right now the skin used is the DefautSkin page  
vmassol - (15:56): you can change it to be RDFaSkin too  
vmassol - (15:56): but yes do the easy thing firt  
vmassol - (15:56): first  
vmassol - (15:56): (not that it's hard :))  
bblfish - (15:57): ok, only two errors on the pages http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/hjs&charset=(detect+automatically)&doctype=Inline&group=0  
vmassol - (15:59): bblfish: note that you've changed the doctype for all pages in your wiki  
bblfish - (15:59): ah I put an #if in there  
vmassol - (15:59): ah right  
vmassol - (15:59): didn't see it  
bblfish - (16:00): yep, it works. Cool.  
bblfish - (16:00): ok, I need to get out of here… !  
bblfish - (16:00): :-)

bblfish - (18:49): Someone lost their account on myxwiki  
bblfish - (18:50): XWikiLaczoka I think was his name  
bblfish - (18:50): did that get garbage collected?  
vmassol - (19:00): yes possibly  
vmassol - (19:00): I removed spam accounts yesterday  
vmassol - (19:00): a spam account = same first name as last name or no first name and no last name  
bblfish - (19:02): ok  
bblfish - (19:03): are there a lot of spam accounts on webid.myxwiki?  
vmassol - (19:03): I removed users only from myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (19:03): not from webid.myxwiki.org  
bblfish - (19:03): ah. Ok the guy seems to have lost his account on webid  
vmassol - (19:04): I don't see how that would happen  
vmassol - (19:04): unless he deleted his profile page for ex  
vmassol - (19:04): what's his id?  
vmassol - (19:04): (is it still there?)  
bblfish - (19:04): no gone … Let me find it  
vmassol - (19:05): there's no way it can go  
vmassol - (19:05): unless an admin removed his page or he did it  
bblfish - (19:05): http://webid.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiLaczok  
bblfish - (19:05): Perhaps he was using the CreateCert script and did not properly save his account  
vmassol - (19:05): I have no idea what creatcert does  
vmassol - (19:06): and whether it can be used on someone else profiles without being logged, etc

nuvolari - (20:00): bah :/  
nuvolari - (20:00): vmassol: is it worth the money?  
nuvolari - (20:00): I like the community edition already  
vmassol - (20:02): no idea  
vmassol - (20:02): I don't pay for it  
vmassol - (20:02): we have free licenses for xwiki dev  
nuvolari - (20:03): I'll see what I can find on the site, looking around at this moment  
LadySerena - (20:05): seems the way my KittyStore handles its backends and their configurations was a stroke of genius  
nuvolari - (20:06): :D rawr!  
LadySerena - (20:06): mew!  
LadySerena - (20:07): seems like I should set up modules and configurations the same way in vCoreSystem  
nuvolari - (20:15): vmassol: should you be forced to place a score comparison on netbeans, eclipse and IJ, what would they be?  
LadySerena - (20:16): oddly enough, NetBeans is called "Sun Studio" on my laptop  
nuvolari - (20:17): I used to like Netbean  
nuvolari - (20:17): IntelliJ feels a great deal faster than eclipse  
LadySerena - (20:22): somehow, it feels like I should have more than init() and run() for my service plugin interface  
LadySerena - (20:23): and more than runView(String[] url), runPost(String[] url), and runReply(String[] url) in my module plugin interface  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 20:24  
vmassol - (20:29): nuvolari: it doesn't work this way  
vmassol - (20:29): if I ask you to compare 2 persons: who is the best?  
vmassol - (20:29): you can't answer because it depends on the criteria for "best"  
vmassol - (20:30): it's the same for IDEs  
vmassol - (20:30): you need to define precisely what you're comparing  
vmassol - (20:30): otherwise it's meaningless  
LadySerena - (20:30): exactly  
vmassol - (20:31): I use the 3 IDEs, depending on my mood, the phase of the moon, and other such criteria :)  
vmassol - (20:32): actually my algorithm is: use one till I get fed up by it on some problem, then switch to the other, then repeat  
vmassol - (20:32): they all have their problems  
nuvolari - (20:43): heh, understood  
nuvolari - (20:44): I don't have any problem using anyone of them  
nuvolari - (20:44): it's just that at work they make you feel like an outside if you use something other than the "norm"  
nuvolari - (20:45): But as I said, I do like IntelliJ so far  
vmassol - (20:47): that's the one I'm currently using  
nuvolari - (20:52): bah :/ i'm tired  
nuvolari - (20:52): g'night  
vmassol - (20:52): night

sdumitriu - (22:04): Observe the layout:  
sdumitriu - (22:04): - header (narrow, like in Toucan)  
sdumitriu - (22:04): - content menu  
vmassol - (22:04): nice page action menus that are unobtrusive  
vmassol - (22:05): the breadcrumb and history/attachment/etc bar looks a bit strange though  
sdumitriu - (22:06): WDYM? It always looked like this in Colibri  
vmassol - (22:07): I like your new design but I think if that bar was removed it would be even better  
vmassol - (22:07): maybe as icons too next to the other ones  
vmassol - (22:08): and maybe the last modified by info could be on the same line as the breadcrumb  
vmassol - (22:08): just thinking aloud  
vmassol - (22:14): I really like the page action menus on the right  
sdumitriu - (22:14): Yes, us too  
vmassol - (22:17): a la foswiki
